com.fluidops.iwb.widget
Interface Widget<T>

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractChartWidget, AbstractWidget, AccessForbiddenWidget, ActionableResultWidget, BarChartWidget, ChartWidget, CodeExecutionWidget, ComponentWidget, ConfigDocumentation, ConfigEditWidget, ContextEditTableWidget, DataEntryTableWidget, DataInputWidget, DataTypePropEntryTableWidget, DBLPPublicationWidget, DisplayConfigurationWidget, DownloadWidget, EditorialWidget, ExportRDFWidget, FacebookWidget, FileUploadWidget, GMapWidget, GraphWidget, HeatMapWidget, IFrameWidget, ImageWidget, ImportRDFWidget, LastFMWidget, LikeWidget, LineChartWidget, LinkedInWidget, NamespaceConfigurationWidget, NewsWidget, PathQueryWidget, PieChartWidget, PivotWidget, QueryResultWidget, RadarChartWidget, SearchResultWidget, SearchWidget, SemWikiWidget, SimpleNewInstanceWidget, SkypeWidget, SPARQLInterfaceWidget, StockChartWidget, TableResultWidget, TagCloudWidget, TimelineWidget, TimeplotWidget, TreeResultWidget, TripleEditorWidget, TwitterWidget, UserManagementAdministrationWidget, UserRegistrationWidget, VoIDWidget, WikiDiagnosticsWidget, WikiManagementWidget, YouTubeWidget
public interface Widget<T>

base class for IWB widgets TODO: We need documentation for this interface (and related classes) Newbies never get it. Typical confusion is caused by: What is an input, a configuration, a mapping, a mapping function, an operator (Op)? How do these relate? We also need to be more consistent in terminology. Note: if the widget requires additional ACL permissions, the widget needs to implement the WidgetAccessControl interface. I.e. the generic script widget can request access to the specific script that should be executed, which means mapping of scripts<-->users can easily be controlled through ACLs.

Author:
aeb
